intro: Hesperonix accidens, commonly known as the Pacific coast lichen, is a unique species belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. This lichen is often found growing on tree bark and rock surfaces in coastal regions, thriving in humid and shaded environments. It plays an important role in nutrient cycling and serves as a habitat for various microorganisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
